reviews.text: Our stay at Lone Pine was a relaxing experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Premier Garden Room which is on the ground floor and very convenient, with large shutters that opened up to a great view.Location was good(right on the beach) and close to night markets and food, although the hawker food in Ferringhi was a very small selection and quite westernised so we got a cab to Gerney drive where the food was so much better and the selection huge.That was probably my only negative about Ferringhi beach, the choice of food was minimal and catered to western palates. I would definately stay at Lone Pine again as It is much smaller than other hotels in the Area which I prefer
reviews.title: friendly staff fabulous rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We're staying here for a period of 3 nights and as I write this we're still at the hotel. Reason? The dreary weather! It has been raining intermittently for the past 48 hours since we reached here. We got a sea facing room and the room itself is simply fantastic. We wonder why more hotels don't place fans in their rooms as this is a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Fantastic room but F&B needs improvement

reviews.text: Service upon check in was great and the staff were very helpful overall. However, the F&B at The Bungalow requires some improvements. Breakfast service could be improved by ensuring food served are not past their expiry date. We were about to tuck into our yogurt when we realised that they had expired 3 days ago. When we informed the restaurant, the staff nonchalantly took the yogurt and just said 'thank you' and walked away. Offering us an alternative would have been a nicer touch, considering the hotel is one from the higher end. We hope to enjoy the rest of our stay here.
reviews.title: The perfect place to refresh and rejuvenate yourself!

reviews.text: We stayed from 21 to 24 August 2011 and must say that the Lone Pine Hotel website does not do justice to the reality of the hotel (my apologies to the Marketing Department for saying so)!
reviews.title: Perfectly located oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment we arrived, we just KNEW we had made the right choice. From the understated charm of the architecture to the friendly-but-not-fake hositality of the staff, the bright, cheery, spacious and very well thought-out rooms, the more-than-adequate breakfast buffet, the large and clean swimming pool, the gorgeous beach front... Everything consipired to make this the perfect holiday!
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed with the renovations. The hotel is aesthetically pleasing, the gardens look very nice.
reviews.title: Nice but noisy, breakfast staff need to be happier!

reviews.text: Check in was smooth, and the fruit drink was much appreciated
reviews.title: Dont stay Here!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had room 223, a deluxe suite with the day room. We did not use the day room much because the free WIFI reception was very poor in this room.
reviews.title: Great for relaxation

reviews.text: We had to ask for a DVD player because it was missing, once replace the remote had lfat battery and it took 1 phone and 1 visit to reception to get the batteries replaced.
reviews.title: Not cool - locals ogle at the fence while you in pool and leave rubbish everywhere

reviews.text: The room was vey comfortable, the shower was fabulous.
reviews.title: Still room for improvement but pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you like boutique hotels, this is the place to be in Batu Ferringhi. ultra modern and tastefully decorated rooms, lobby and inviting pool. this definitely would be our first choice should we visit this area again.
reviews.title: gorgeous boutique hotel

reviews.text: Lone Pine has gorgeous rooms but it is let down by a very indifferent front desk. When I asked for help from the front desk, the guy at the front desk looks at you blank, never once saying " I shall check Sir" or "Good Morning Sir". I have to ask him if he understood the instructions or question. Then he sits there without making eye contact and you wonder if he is ignoring you or attending to your enquiry.
reviews.title: Indifferent Front desk

reviews.text: What a pity that a physically attractive hotel is let down by the front desk staff.
reviews.title: Hotel attendance treated us transparent!
very nice
reviews.text: When we reached the hotel, there were a group of Harley Davidson bikers arrived too. All the lobby attendants were busy looking at the bikes and bikers without noticing our arrival at all! My hubby had to unload 2 big luggages and a few bags from our car and walked to the lobby. No one helped him and he had to do by himself and we had the feeling that my hubby was the portal working there! We waited for 45 minutes and our grand deluxe suite was not ready. While we were waiting we found out that there were some guests arrived later than us were served welcome drinks but we were still sitting without any welcome drink! By then I went to the attendant and told him if they didn't have the suite ready for my family I would just walked away! He quickly went and checked it out. Came back to us and said the room is ready but not the separate living area. So we were only able to use the room until another 1 hour (by then already almost 5pm!) to use the living area! After all these bad experiences we just concluded that we couldn't depend on their service... We just enjoyed ourselves in the bath tub at the balcony and swimming pool. Breakfast had varieties of local food but not tasty. When I called and wanted to order the special durian cake that the hotel restaurant promoted in their room brochure, they said this cake needed 24 hours in advance order. I wonder how the 24 hours in advance policy works? The location is very good, extremely poor service, average food, below average cleanliness. If you would to spend such rate in Lone Pine, I would recommend Rasa Sayang Resort & Spa or Hard Rock Hotel (King Suite only).

firstly catch a taxi - its a long taxi ride but just order it at the airport. the hotel charges a small fortune. free complimentary mocktail by the pool was nice and unexpected. Pool was a bit too cool though. dont know whether its a heated pool or it depends on the heat from the sun but we were reluctant to go in or stay in for too long. sounds picky as i know its hot and humid but in Langkawi at Pelangi Meritus the pool was perfect even at night. I also think the pool closes too early at 8pm. there were couple of nights when came home from sweaty night markets and just wanted to jump in the pool but it was closed. At Meritus its open till 11pm. I understand lone pine doesnt want any noise but I think a 10pm close is fine. There is a taxi rack right outside it you want to go to penang hill. Or if you want to go to georgetown just catch a bus at the bus stop right outside too (101 bus I think - about 5 MYR for 2 people - just watch your valuables) When you go outside resort turn right and walk along the street for short distance to all the night markerts and a lovely little bar on the beach called BORA BORA. Also great food at Jewel or the North. The bath tub outside is great. The breakfast is fine. Its a very clean and nice little resort. Very well maintained. Staff are friendly. The rooms are clean and new. A few tiny Ants around. I dont think Ive ever seen ants so small. Overall, Id say here again just be nice to get the pool open later and make it a little bit warmer.
reviews.title: Very bad sound proofing. I can hear very loud music from the bar!

reviews.text: From the wonderful welcome by the young Italian management member of staff to the gorgeous rooms, this is the one to stay at. Right on the beach, good food, luxury rooms with fabulous balcony bath and stunning updated decor. Great staff, good food. Quick service, and free yummy boxes of cakes each night. What more could you ask for?
reviews.title: Don't go anywhere else.

reviews.text: Yes, there are bigger hotels but THIS is the best, by far. Thank you, Lone Pine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is certainly a beautiful hotel with a beautiful renovation. It's right at the beginning of the night markets and a 2min walk to palm beach food court which has a fantastic choice of food incredibly cheap.
reviews.title: Recommending the Lone Pine, Ferringhi Beach, Penang ...

reviews.text: Saying all of this the hotel feels a bit sterile and really lacks "Malaysian charm" we found at other hotels. The room cleaning was quite poor and we constantly had to call housekeeping for things. The food in the hotel is average for the price and much better food choices can be found outside.
reviews.title: Best hotel in batu, don't stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: All in all a nice hotel at a reasonable price!
reviews.title: PEN-Lone Pine Hotel, Rm 303 (Dlx)
